tech.lity.rea.skatolo.gui.group

Class Accordion

  • java.lang.Object
    • tech.lity.rea.skatolo.gui.group.ControllerGroup<T>
      • tech.lity.rea.skatolo.gui.group.ControlGroup<Accordion>
        • tech.lity.rea.skatolo.gui.group.Accordion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControlListener, ControllerInterface<Accordion>, SkatoloConstants

    public class Accordion
extends ControlGroup<Accordion>

    The Accordion is a list of ControlGroups which can be expanded and collapsed. Only one item can be open at a time.

    See Also:
    skatolo.ControllerGroup, skatolo.ControlGroup

      • remove

        public Accordion remove(ControllerInterface<?> theGroup)
        Removes a ControlGroup from the accordion AND from skatolo remove(ControllerInterface theGroup) overwrites it's super method. if you want to remove a ControlGroup only from the accordion, use removeItem(ControlGroup).
        Specified by:

      • removeItem

        public Accordion removeItem(ControlGroup<?> theGroup)
        Removes a ControlGroup from the accordion and puts it back into the default tab of skatolo. if you dont have access to a ControlGroup via a variable, use skatolo.group("theNameOfTheGroup") which will return a
        Returns:
        Accordion

      • updateItems

        public Accordion updateItems()
        UpdateItems is called when changes such as remove, change of height is performed on an accordion. updateItems() is called automatically for such cases, but by calling updateItems manually an update will be forced.
        Returns:
        Accordion

      • controlEvent

        public void controlEvent(ControlEvent theEvent)
        Description copied from interface: ControlListener
        controlEvent is called by skatolo's ControlBroadcaster to inform available listeners about value changes. Use the CallbackListener to get informed when actions such as pressed, release, drag, etc are performed.
        Specified by:
        controlEvent in interface ControlListener
        Overrides:
        controlEvent in class ControlGroup<Accordion>
